condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.2 : IDPs and crises affected vulnerable populations are provided access to gender responsive and life-saving emergency WASH services

description.narrative: UNICEF provided a comprehensive gender-sensitive WASH response to emergency affected populations in Yemen. The first-line response through the Rapid Response Teams (RRTs) and Quick Impact Projects (QIPs) contributed to contain the cholera transmission. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:23/12/2019

title.narrative: (COVID19) Number of people reached with critical WASH supplies (including hygiene items) and services.
Number of people provided with gender responsive standard hygiene kit (basic and consumable and benefiting from household level water treatment at cholera high risk area.
Number of UNICEF- targeted population in humanitarian situation provided access to appropriate sanitation facilities and living environment free of open defection.
UNICEF-targeted population in humanitarian situations accessing sufficient quantity of water of appropriate quality for drinking, cooking and personal hygiene
